questions.title: Background
questions.text:
We are interested in studying how users learn to use computer applications. Specifically, when there are multiple ways of completing the same task, how do users learn the 'better/expert' ways.


For example, using the keyboard shortcut to save a document instead of selecting 'save' from the menu is typically a faster way of accomplishing the same task.


We are interested in learning what tools/methods users employ to learn these 'better/expert' techniques.

questions.instructions: Do you try to learn shortcuts or better ways of accomplishing the same task when you use computer applications repeatedly?
When you consider applications that you frequently use, how many times a year do you learn a better way of accomplishing the same task?
What are methods you use to learn better/faster ways of using the application? Check all that apply:

questions.text: System suggestion other than tip of the day
Read about it in an article

questions.instructions: Are there any other methods you use to improve which are not listed above? (Optional)
Think of a time when you learned a better way of doing a task.  Please state the application, what method you used to learn this new information, and give a brief description of what you learned.
